oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Front porch of Belle Meade Mansion
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front porch of Belle Meade Mansion from northeast.

Belle Meade Mansion was originally built as a brick Federal-style home by John Harding. William Giles Harding, his son, had the home enlarged and altered into a Greek Revival style home in 1853. These Greek Revival changes included covering the brick with Stucco and the addition of the limestone columns.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jones, Lester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Belle Meade Plantation (Tenn.); Dwellings--Tennessee; Historic buildings; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
